item.title: Add some festive flowers to the office to celebrate Chinese New Year and bring some brightness
item.description:
Starting January 19, 2015, Viva La Fleur will debut a new collection of long-lasting bouquets and table arrangements. The color palette for this collection features predominantly red, orange, and yellow tones, symbolizing love, luck, and fortune, perfectly aligning with the festive season. This arrangement, part of Viva La Fleur’s new collection, showcases deep red roses, hydrangeas, and caspia accented with brown twigs. You can find this arrangement in Viva La Fleur’s online shop here...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/add-some-festive-flowers-to-the-office-to-celebrate-chinese-new-year-and-bring-some-brightness/

item.title: Bloem is set to open its flagship store at The Heeren
item.description:
Source: Bloem’s Facebook page. This wedding bouquet showcases Bloem’s artistry and meticulousness. Bloem, the floral design studio, is expanding its presence in Singapore with a new flagship store at Robinson’s The Heeren. This location will introduce a wider audience to their distinctive and customized floral creations. Since 2013, Bloem has established a strong reputation for its tailored floral arrangements for corporate clients, according to founder and CEO, Sukri Kadola. The Orchard Road store marks a significant step in the brand’s growth trajectory, broadening its reach to a larger customer base...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/bloem-is-set-to-open-its-flagship-store-at-the-heeren/

item.title: Singapore is set to release a coin set called The Splendour of Native Orchids Series
item.description:
The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is releasing a special coin set called “The Splendor of Native Orchids Series.” This set includes ten 999 fine silver proof coins, each showcasing a different orchid from the “Native Orchids of Singapore” coin series issued between 2011 and 2015. This series pays tribute to the beautiful orchids that were once plentiful in Singapore, some of which can still be found in its forests...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/singapore-is-set-to-release-a-coin-set-called-the-splendour-of-native-orchids-series/
